qas.question: How do adolescents use online technology?

answers.text: experiment with emerging identities and to broaden their peer groups

qas.question: To what does "channel" refer in terms if adolescent communication?
What is a potential negative effect of using newer online channels of communication?

context: When discussing peer relationships among adolescents it is also important to include information in regards to how they communicate with one another. An important aspect of communication is the channel used. Channel, in this respect, refers to the <a1_0>form of communication<a1_0/>, be it face-to-face, email, text message, phone or other. Teens are heavy users of newer forms of communication such as text message and social-networking websites such as Facebook, especially when communicating with peers. Adolescents use online technology to <a0_0>experiment with emerging identities and to broaden their peer groups<a0_0/>, such as increasing the amount of friends acquired on Facebook and other social media sites. Some adolescents use these newer channels to enhance relationships with peers however there can be negative uses as well such as <a2_0>cyberbullying<a2_0/>, as mentioned previously, and negative impacts on the family.
